column1: Rectal prolapse occurs most often in children under age 6 and in the elderly.
In children, it can be found with cystic fibrosis, worm infections of the intestine, or long-term diarrhea.
In adults, it is usually found with constipation, or with a muscle or nerve problem in the pelvic or genital area.
The health care provider will perform a physical exam, which will include a rectal exam.
In adults, surgery is usually cures the prolapse.
